alert.note: Alert for Huntingdon (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 07 at 3:35AM EDT until May 08 at 5:20PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in State College PA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Aughwick Creek At Shirleysburg affecting Huntingdon County. For the Aughwick Creek...including Shirleysburg...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING TO TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Aughwick Creek At Shirleysburg. * WHEN...From early this morning to tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Aughwick Creek at Shirleysburg exceeds its banks. Several homes are affected. At 12.0 feet, Flood waters from Aughwick Creek cover portions of Gilbo Road, Aughwick Mills Road and Keystone Road in Shirley Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:30 AM EDT Saturday the stage was 9.3 feet. - Forecast...The creek is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 10.8 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 10.9 feet on 01/02/2003. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon by 300 PM EDT.
